text.tspan: Reliability of a positive test result dependending on the mother's age.

flowRoot.flowPara: Humans have 23 pairs of chromosome, which are strands of DNA that carry genetic information. A trisomy is a chromosomal condition that occurs when there are three copies of a particular chromosome instead of the expected two.

Trisomy 21 is due to an extra chromosome 21 and is the most common trisomy at the time of birth. Trisomy 21, also called Down syndrome, is associated with mild to moderate intellectual disabilities and may also lead to digestive disease and congenital heart defects. It is estimated that trisomy 21 is present in 1 out of every 1150 births.
When you're pregnant your blood contains fragments of your fetus' DNA. The prenatal Test is a new type of test that analyzes this DNA in a sample of your blood to determine the risk of trisomy 21.
A positive result does not necessarilly mean that Trisomy 21 is present
In the graph to the right you can see the probability that a positive result actually means the presente of Trisomy 21. This probability is derived from risk factors associated with the mother's age.
1 Nicolaides KH, et al. Am J Obstet Gynecol. 2012 Nov, 207(5):374.e1-6
